meanings.definition: To use something in a way that is harmful or morally wrong.
meanings.sent1: He was abusing his power by taking advantage of others.
meanings.sent2: The man was caught abusing the trust of his friends.
meanings.sent3: The naughty child was caught abusing the rules of the game.
meanings.sent4: The factory was abusing the environment with its toxic waste.
meanings.sent5: The dictator was abusing his authority, causing suffering to his people.

meanings.definition: To treat someone with cruelty or violence.
meanings.sent1: The bully was abusing the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The abuser was caught abusing their partner physically.
meanings.sent3: The villain in the movie was abusing their henchmen for no reason.
meanings.sent4: The storm was abusing the coastline, causing destruction.
meanings.sent5: The criminal was abusing their victims, leaving them in fear.

meanings.definition: To speak to someone in an offensive or insulting way.
meanings.sent1: She was abusing her classmates with hurtful words.
meanings.sent2: The customer was caught abusing the staff at the store.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was playfully abusing the audience with jokes.
meanings.sent4: The wind was abusing the trees, making them sway violently.
meanings.sent5: The politician was abusing their opponent during the debate.
